column1: What is Singtel Fibre Broadband?
column2: Singtel Fibre Broadband is Singtel's high speed fibre service and it is delivered via an opticalfibre which is run directly into one's home. Through Singtel Fibre Broadband services consumers can enjoy amazing download speeds of up to 1Gbps which is superior to that of any other existing DSL or cable broadband network available. This allows for ultra high speed Internet access digital voice Internet television services home networking and other lifestyle applications. Customers can enjoy bandwidth intensive applications such as simultaneous music downloads home office and home networking with greater ease and also run multiple applications on one PC such as online chat web access and music or video downloads.

column1: What is Fixed Line Number Retention Service?
column2: Fixed Line Number Retention is a number portability service that allows you to retain your existing telephone phone number when you switch from other service provider to Singtel. Enjoy crystal clear calls with our Singtel Telephone Line or unlimited local calls with Home Digital Line without giving up your existing telephone phone number. Visit our Singtel Shops if you wish to apply for this service. Upon application we would arrange on your behalf with the other service provider to terminate your existing fixed-line service and transfer it to Singtel. The process would typically take more than 7 working days as time is required by the other operator to process the request. Once the service is activated your telephone number (from the other service provider) will be port over.

column1: What are the benefits I can enjoy with Singtel Fibre Broadband?
column2: A. Consistently fast speeds IDA findings show that Singtel is fastest in average international download speeds among broadband users on 200Mbps plans as of May 2015. With no international bandwidth cap you can surf web content at speeds of up to 1Gbps. B. Multiple access multiple users Even with multiple users and devices in the family everyone can enjoy smooth Internet connection with Singtel Fibre Broadband. Be it on laptops tablets or mobile phones the simultaneous multiple access supports even bandwidth-intensive applications such as data downloading or music and video streaming. C. End-to-end service With an end-to-end solution that comprises bundled high-end routers installation and maintenance services in addition to Internet access Singtel cares by ensuring your Broadband experience is hassle-free right from the start.

column1: I'm interested in Singtel Fibre Broadband service how do I sign up?
column2: You can visit any Singtel shop check out our website here to sign up or call 1688 to enquire.

column1: What service plans are available if I want to enjoy Singtel Fibre Broadband services?
column2: Please refer to the available Broadband plans here.

column1: Can I upgrade my Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan anytime within the contractual period? Will there be any charges?
column2: Yes you may upgrade your Singtel Fibre Home Bundle or Fibre Entertainment Bundle plan anytime within the contractual period without any charges.

column1: I am currently a Singtel Home Broadband subscriber on ADSL. Can I apply for Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans without terminating my existing Singtel Home Broadband ADSL services?
column2: Yes you can. This is because Singtel Home Broadband on ADSL uses telephone lines which are different from the fibre optic infrastructure which will deliver high quality Singtel Fibre Broadband services into your home.

column1: I am currently a SingNet Home Broadband customer on ADSL without any contract. Can I upgrade to Singtel Fibre Broadband? How do I go about doing so?
column2: Yes you may sign up for Singtel Fibre Broadband if you are currently a SingNetHome Broadband customer on ADSL without any contract by visiting any Singtel shop clicking here or by calling 1688.

column1: I am currently a SingNet customer. Am I eligible for the upgrade to Singtel FibreBroadband services? Will there be any charges?
column2: Yes you are eligible for upgrading to Singtel Fibre Broadband services without any additional charges.

column1: What happens to the contract balance on my original contract of my mio Plan / mio Home after I have upgraded to a Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan?
column2: Your original contract will be cease and you will start your new Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan on a 24-month contract if you meet the eligibility criteria.

column1: What happens if I have existing contracts with Singtel TV and/or Home Digital Line?
column2: If you are an existing Singtel TV subscriber you are eligible to sign up for a 24-month Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan. Your existing Singtel TV content contract (if any) will still continue. If you are an existing Home Digital Line subscriber you are eligible to sign up for a 24-month Singtel Fibre Broadband service contract anytime within the duration of your Home Digital Line contract.

column1: Do I need to change out my current SNBB UserID email and password when I sign up for any Singtel Fibre Entertainment Bundle+ package?
column2: No. Your existing SingNet access ID email UserID and password will remain unchanged.

column1: Can I maintain my existing user ID if I am to migrate from dialup or Magix plan to Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan?
column2: For Dial-up customers you will be able to retain your existing user ID and email address. For Magix customers you will be able to retain your user ID only if the user ID is available.

column1: Will there be any charges for conversion if I plan to migrate from SingNet 56K dial-up or Magix plan to Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans?
column2: No there will not be additional charges for conversion from SingNet 56K dial-up or Magix to Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans.

column1: Will there be any downtime if I am to migrate from dialup or Magix plan to Singtel Fibre Broadband?
column2: Yes you may experience downtime on your existing services on the day of your installation.

column1: May I sign up for Singtel Fibre Broadband if my estate is currently not Fibre to the Home ready?
column2: The fibre network will be deployed geographically according to NetLink Trust’s deployment timeline. For NetLink Trust Fibre rollout timeline please click here.

column1: If I am going to relocate to a new house where the area is without Fibre to the Home coverage what should I do?
column2: In the event that your Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans cannot be provisioned due to Fibre to the Home coverage issues SingNet reserves the right to terminate your current plan without termination charges and to provide you with a no frills 15M mio Home ADSL plan (Applicable for all Fibre Entertainment Bundles) or 15M Singtel Home Broadband on ADSL (applicable for Singtel Fibre Home Bundle bundles). You will have to continue to serve the remaining months of your contract. All promotional VASes that are exclusive with the Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan would cease. In the event that if you do not wish to continue with your Singtel Fibre Broadband services during relocation and do not want a 15M mio Home ADSL (Applicable for all Fibre Entertainment Bundles) or 15M Singtel Home Broadband on ADSL contract (applicable for Singtel Fibre Home Bundles) then termination charges for your current Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans shall apply.

column1: I am currently on the 300M Fibre Entertainment Bundle Plan and would like to terminate my TV pack (TV pack is out of contract).Can I re-contract my Fibre Broadband to the new 300M Fibre Home Bundle Plan (24-month contract)?
column2: No. You can’t re-contract your broadband to 300M Fibre Home Bundle Plan as our 300M FHB plan is no longer available. However you may re-contract to 500M/1Gbps FHB plan.

column1: I am currently on Singtel mioHome plan. Can I upgrade to the new Fibre Home Bundle/Fibre Entertainment Bundle+ Plans?
column2: Yes you may migrate to any of the new Fibre Home Bundle/Fibre Entertainment Bundle+ plans.The registration fee of $53.50 will be waived.

column1: Will a new wireless router be issued with the sign up of a new Fibre Home Bundle plan?
column2: Yes a wireless Dual-band AC router will be issued with the sign-up of the new Singtel Fibre Home Bundle plans. However if you are a re-contracting Fibre Broadband customer you will be issued a new wireless Dual-band AC router only if your current router is incompatible with the speed of your new Fibre Broadband plan.

column1: Can I purchase my own equipment instead of using the devices issued by SingNet?
column2: All necessary equipment to enable your Singtel Fibre Broadband services are provided unless otherwise stated. Please note that SingNet does not guarantee and support equipment that is not type-approved by both IDA and SingNet.

column1: What equipment is required to enable my Singtel Fibre Broadband service?
column2: - 1st TP (Fibre Termination Point) which is to be installed by NetLink Trust - ONT (Optical Network Terminal) or ONR (Optical Network Router) this device is to connect to the home devices

column1: What are the installation charges like?
column2: If you missed your free prior appointment with NetLink Trust an installation charge of $235.40 (with 7% GST) for High Rise or $481.50(with 7% GST) for landed property is applicable. The above amount is charged on behalf of NetLink Trust. If you have already made an appointment with NetLink Trust to lay the fibre and install the 1st TP (Fibre Termination Point) to your home a Singtel installation appointment would only be required to set up your Singtel Fibre Broadband services. An installation charge of $90* (weekdays) or $145* (weekends) by Singtel is applicable for installation of equipment activation and demo of service. This installation charge will also be levied if the customer is not available for installation appointment or does not meet the minimum system requirements. Wiring charge of $80.25 will apply for wiring service from the modem to each computer/device within the first 35m additional $10 is applicable for every subsequent 5m wiring length. The wiring service is free for 1st Singtel TV set-top box on Singtel Fibre Entertainment Bundle however it is chargeable for each subsequent new Singtel TV set-top box sign-ups. A registration charge of $53.50* is applicable for all Singtel Fibre Home Bundle plans. * inclusive of 7% GST.

column1: When can I request for installation to take place?
column2: You are required to book an appointment with NetLink Trust to lay the fibre and install the 1st TP to your home. Your NetLink Trust installation appointment may be scheduled at any of the following times:  Mondays – Fridays (excluding Weekends & Public Holidays) High-Rise 9am - 11am 11am - 1pm 2pm - 4pm 4pm - 6pm Landed 9am - 1 pm 2pm - 6pm      Thereafter you are required to attend to another appointment by SingNet to enable your Singtel Fibre BroadBand services Your SingNet Fibre installation appointment may be scheduled at any of the following times:  Mondays – Saturdays (excluding Sundays and Public Holidays) High-Rise 9am - 10.30am 10.30am - 12pm 12pm - 1.30pm 2pm - 3.30pm 3.30pm - 5pm 5pm - 6.30pm Landed 9am - 1pm 2pm - 6pm         The installation team will arrive within the indicated time slot

column1: Can I self-install my Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans?
column2: Due to the complexity of Fibre to the Home all Singtel Fibre Broadband service plans will require an installation by a qualified SingNet installer.

column1: What happens if I miss my scheduled NetLink Trust installation timeslot?
column2: You are required to notify us at least 3 days in advance if you need to change your NetLink Trust appointment time. You may do so by calling Singtel Customer Care at 1688. Note that if you missed the NetLink Trust installation appointment or changed the NetLink Trust appointment without notifying SingNet 3 days in advance NetLink Trust cancellation fees will apply.

column1: Can I reschedule my Singtel Fibre installation?
column2: Yes. You can reschedule your Singtel Fibre installation here or go to My Account > Account Activities > My Appointments. Please note that you can only select from the available dates and timeslots indicated.

column1: Can I purchase my own equipment instead of using the devices issued by SingNet?
column2: All necessary equipment to enable your Singtel Fibre Broadband services are provided unless otherwise stated. Please note that SingNet does not guarantee and support equipment that is not type-approved by both the IDA and SingNet.

column1: What happens if any of the equipment is damaged?
column2: For the duration of your Singtel Fibre Broadband service contract you are entitled to one-for-one replacement of the mio Box ONT and/or the set top box - except under conditions deemed abnormal to typical wear and tear. Such conditions include but are not limited to: • spilled liquids including permanent discolouration of equipment casing  • attempted modifications to or repair of the equipment other than by a SingNet authorized agent  • cracks dented or chipped equipment casing  • permanent defacement of equipment casing including markings due to permanent/inerasable marker or irremovable dirt and disfigurement of the Singtel logo.  • tampering/torn or missing manufacturing labels such as Serial No./Warranty of the device  • other vandalisms like permanent glue on the ports points and casing

column1: I have damaged my Fibre equipment. How can I replace them?
column2: You will be required to purchase the equipment (at prevailing rates) for replacement. Such equipment are: • Fibre Patch Cord  • ONT (Optical Network Terminal) or ONR (Optical Network Router)  For other equipment such as the Fibre Termination Point a NetLink Trust installation will be required and charges will be (at prevailing rates) dependant on scope of work.

column1: Can I use my fibre equipment at my friend's home since he subscribes to the same Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan as I do?
column2: No. All your fibre equipment is preconfigured to a specific premise. It will not function when you move the equipment to another location.

column1: I have an existing ADSL modem or mio Box. Can I use this instead?
column2: No your existing equipment is not configured for use on a Fibre to the Home network.

column1: What is the minimum setup for my computer?
column2: For plans up to 1Gbps:    Windows/ Mac User Processor Intel i3 or above System Memory 2GB  RAM Minimum Network Card 1000 Base-T Network Interface Card is recommended Cable CAT5e/6 LAN cable   For 10Gbps plans:    Macintosh PC Processor Core i7 minimum Core i7-4790K minimum System Memory 8GB RAM minimum 8GB RAM minimum Hard disk SSD SSD PCI-E interface OS Mac OS X Window 7 Windows 8.1 Windows 10 Cable Cat6 Cat6a cable Cat6 Cat6a cable Network Card 10 Gigabit Ethernet port (10GBase-T) network card or Thunderbolt™ 2 to 10 Gigabit Ethernet adaptor (e.g. SANLink2) 10 Gigabit Ethernet port (10GBase-T) network card Examples of Supported Devices Mac Pro with Thunderbolt Ethernet adaptor Asus X99-E WS PCIE motherboard assembled in a workstation

column1: If I experience problems with my connection and request for an on-site check do I have to pay for a service call?
column2: Please call 1688 for assistance on your broadband connection issue. Our technical helpdesk will run through a series of network diagnostics to advise and resolve your connection issue. Subsequently we may arrange for an on-site assessment to resolve the connection. If our technical helpdesk have identified that the cause of network connection issues might be due to 3rd party devices connected to your broadband service i.e. personal laptop/tablet an on-site assessment request will be charged at $60 (weekdays/weekends).

column1: I had requested for on-site service assessment and the issue has been resolved since. Can I call to cancel the appointment?
column2: Yes. Please call in 1688 to cancel at least 2 hours before your allocated timeslot and no charges will be incurred.

column1: I’m on Unlimited Fibre on 3rd party router and I require assistance to set up my connection. Can I call Singtel?
column2: Our engineers specialise only in devices/equipment sold by Singtel. For 3rd party devices we recommend that you refer to the device manufacturer for assistance as our engineers are not trained in these devices. Please note that the on-site assessment will still be applicable at $60 (weekdays/weekends).

column1: What is not supported by Singtel’s on-site assessment?
column2: Our engineers specialise in devices and equipment sold by Singtel. For 3rd party devices we recommend that you refer to the device manufacturer for assistance as our engineers are not trained in these devices. Our engineers will also not be able to assist with requests relating to recovery of customer’s computer or provide advice on virus or malware infected computers etc.

column1: If Singtel on-site assessment still unable to resolve my issue is the trip chargeable?
column2: Our field engineers will ensure proper diagnosis & recommend solutions accordingly to address your issue. Please note that on-site assessment charge is applicable.

column1: I was told by the engineer that the cause of the issue might be due to 3rd party devices and despite the on-site assessment the issue still cannot be resolved. Why am I still charged for the on-site assessment?
column2: Our engineers specialise only in devices/ equipment sold by Singtel and will ensure proper diagnosis before recommending solutions to address your issue. However if it is identified that the cause of network connection issues might be due to 3rd party devices connected to your Broadband service we recommend that you refer to the device manufacturer for assistance as our engineers are not trained in these devices. Please note that the on-site assessment will still be applicable at $60 (weekdays/weekends).

column1: Where can I collect my Singtel issued equipment?
column2: Self-Collection Centre For Singtel issued equipment you may collect at the below designated centre upon being advised by our customer care officer:  New Redemption location:  +Serv @ Orchard Central #04-08A  181 Orchard Road Singapore 238896   Operating hours:  Daily 12pm – 8pm (Public Holidays included)    Nearest MRT Station: Somerset MRT

column1: What is MobileShare Supplementary Plan?
column2: MobileShare Supplementary Plan is a service that allows Mobile and Mobile Broadband main subscribers to share the data talk and text (if applicable) bundle with loved ones and/or other devices. This includes sharing of the data allocation with data add-ons such as DATA X and DataMore. Each MobileShare subscription comes with its own SIM Card and unique phone number allowing the MobileShare user to call send SMS/MMS and use data just like any other Mobile subscriber.  Usage by the MobileShare number is deducted from the main price plan bundle and pay-per-use charges apply on excess traffic.

column1: Who can subscribe for MobileShare Supplementary Plan?
column2: Both Mobile and Mobile Broadband subscribers can subscribe for a MobileShare Supplementary Plan.  To be eligible to subscribe to MobileShare Mobile subscribers should be subscribing to any Combo Plan and Mobile Broadband subscribers should be subscribing to a standalone Mobile Broadband plan with data bundle of 10GB or below.

column1: Can I use my MobileShare line for data talk and text?
column2: Yes all MobileShare lines can be used to make and receive calls send and receive SMS/MMS and access data.  It does not matter whether the main line is subscribed to a Mobile or a Mobile Broadband price plan.

column1: What charges are applicable for MobileShare?
column2: For each MobileShare line that you subscribe to there will be a one-time registration fee and SIM card charge as well as a fixed monthly subscription.  Usage will be deducted from the main price plan bundle which includes talktime/SMS/MMS/data if the main line is a Mobile line and data if the main line is a Mobile Broadband line.  Any usage in excess of the bundle by either the main line or the MobileShare line will be charged to the main line at pay-per-use rates.    Main line is a Mobile line Main line is a Mobile Broadband line Monthly Subscription per line $10.70 $10.70    Contract Term 12 months 12 months Data Free 0.5GB Free 0.5GB Local Calls - Free incoming calls - Share bundle for outgoing calls  Pay-per-use for incoming and outgoing calls SMS / MMS Share bundle Pay-per-use Supplementary Lines Up to 3 lines Up to 3 lines What happens if the main line is terminated? MobileShare line will be converted to Combo 1 (3-month contract applies)

column1: I have given my child a MobileShare line. How will I be charged for his usage?
column2: For Mobile customers whose bundle includes talktime SMS/MMS and data the usage by the MobileShare customer will be  offset from the main line bundle. Prevailing excess usage applies  once you have exceeded your voice/data bundle. For example: Lite Plan with 100 mins talktime 800 SMS and 2GB Data MobileShare Plan with 0.5GB Data Total Share: 100 mins talkitme 800 SMS and 2.5GB Data Excess usage will be charged at pay per use. Mobile Broadband plan: Usage will be charged as per pay-per-use on the talktime/sms and mms. Data usage on the supplementary line will offset from the main line data bundle. Prevailing excess charges and monthly bill cap apply after customer has exceeded the free local data bundle.

column1: How many MobileShare Supplementary Plans can I sign up for my mobile line?
column2: You can subscribe for up to to 3 supplementary lines. MobileShare RedPac RedPac Plus and TagLite are all counted as supplementary lines. eg If you already have one RedPac line you can subscribe to a maximum of two more MobileShare lines.Note the line cap of 6 lines per customer inclusive of supplementary plans.

column1: Can I request for the microSIM card when I sign up for MobileShare Supplementary Plan?
column2: Yes you can.

column1: Do I get to enjoy Multi-Line benefits / Birthday Treats for MobileShare Supplementary Plan?
column2: No MobileShare Supplementary Plan is not eligible for Multi-Line discount and line count or for Birthday Treats promo.

column1: My child has an existing mobile line. Can I sign up MobileShare Supplementary Plan under his name?
column2: No our Youth scheme policy only allows each child to one mobile line only.

column1: Can I enjoy Caller-ID and other Add-ons on my MobileShare line?
column2: Yes you can apply for chargeable Add-ons including Caller-ID.  The registration fee & monthly subscription fee for the Add-ons will be charged to MobileShare Supplementary Plan account.

column1: Can I use my MobileShare line when I travel overseas?
column2: Yes please call 1688 or log into the My Singtel app on your mobile to request for roaming service to be activated for your MobileShare line before leaving Singapore.  Note that roaming data plans  are not shareable between the main and supplementary lines.

column1: Can I transfer my MobileShare Supplementary Plan to someone else?
column2: No. MobileShare Supplementary Plan is strictly non-transferable.

column1: What will happen if I transfer my mobile line (Main line) to someone else?
column2: The MobileShare Supplementary Plan will be converted to Combo 1 Plan at national promotional rates.

column1: Is there any penalty if I terminate my MobileShare Supplementary Plan?
column2: There is a contractual period of 12 months. Pre-mature termination will apply accordingly based on the table below:MobileShare Supplementary Plan Penalty - $10.70 (List Price) x balance number of days unfulfilled.

column1: Who is eligible to enjoy 50% discount on MobileShare Supplementary Plan subscription?
column2: Customers who are subscribed to mio Home / Fibre Entertainment Bundle / Fibre Entertainment Bundle+ and have nominated their mobile lines are eligible to Singtel Circle Benefits. The benefit includes a 50% discount for the first 24 months for every new MobileShare Supplementary Plan subscription. The regular monthly subscription of $10.70 will apply from the 25th month onwards

column1: Am I eligible for DataMore?
column2: Yes if you are on Singtel Combo Mobile plans.

column1: Can I share my DataMore bundle with my MobileShare supplementary line(s)?
column2: Yes you can share your DataMore bundle with your MobileShare supplementary lines.

column1: Can my MobileShare supplementary line sign up DataMore?
column2: No. Only the main line is able to sign up for DataMore.

column1: Can I sign up for the new DataMore on my Mobile Broadband line?
column2: No. Only eligible price plans are eligible to sign up for DataMore.

column1: Can I sign up for multiple DataMore?
column2: Yes To achieve 20GB you may sign up for 2 x 10GB DataMore or 1x 10GB + 2 x 5GB.

column1: Is there a registration fee for signing up DataMore?
column2: Yes there is a $10.70 registration fee for signing up DataMore. However this registration fee has been waived.

column1: I am a current DataMore customer can I sign up for the new DataMore?
column2: Yes You are able to sign up for the new DataMore even if you are a current DataMore customer.

column1: I am a current DATA X customer can I sign up for the new DataMore?
column2: Yes You are able to sign up for the new DataMore even if you are a current DATA X 2/X 3 customer.

column1: How do I enjoy the Singtel Circle 50% off DataMore?
column2: Just join our Singtel Circle family on an eligible price plan to enjoy 50% off DataMore and purchase it via our friendly retail staff or call 1688. For more information on Singtel Circle please visit www.singtel.com/circle

column1: What is the minimum subscription period? Can I cancel the service before my DataMore contract end date?
column2: The minimum subscription period vary from 6 -12 months dependent on the DataMore you signed up for. Yes you may cancel your service before the contract ends. There is however a minimum subscription period of 6 months. Early termination charges apply.

column1: Currently there is already a data cap of S$188 per month. Can I still sign up for DataMore?
column2: Yes you can still sign up for DataMore add-on. Excess data usage is only incurred after you have used up your mobile plan bundled data and any data add-on. Excess data charges is $10.70 per GB and capped at $188 per month.

column1: What should I do when I need to relocate the Singtel Distribution Point?
column2: Contact Singtel via the following methods:  Call 1688 Call Singtel Outside Plant Engineering Department (A&A) at 6342 5952 or email g-opeaa2@singtel.com

column1: What is the process of installation?
column2: Upon the home owner’s notification Singtel will initiate a site survey and advice on what shall be carried out. If relocation of existing infrastructure (pipe & cable) is needed Singtel will send the quotation letter to the home owner. Upon receipt of Cheque Singtel will engage relevant authorities like Power Grids NParks and Land Transport Authority for approvals prior to excavation in order to connect the new lead-in pipe provided by the home owner from the gate pillar to the manhole.

column1: How long would the installation take?
column2: Typically 6 to 8 weeks time.

column1: What do I need to prepare before the installation?
column2: Please refer to section "Structured Cabling Within your Home" and "Cable Installation Outside Your Home" or visit IDA.

column1: What do I need to prepare before renovation?
column2: Home owners are required to submit their home building plan to Building and Construction Authority (BCA) for approval.

column1: If the Singtel DP and cable have been shifted or tempered with during the renovation what should I do?
column2: Home owners will need to inform Singtel so that a site survey can be arranged to assess the situation. Singtel will then advice accordingly on what will be required.

column1: When can I recontract my plan?
column2: You can check your recontract eligibility via My Account. For postpaid mobile plans you can also check your recontract eligibility via My Singtel app. An early device upgrade fee will apply if you are recontracting less than 21 months into your contract. For all services a downgrade penalty will apply if you changing to a lower tier plan before your contract ends.

column1: How do I transfer ownership for my Singtel services?
column2: For postpaid mobile plans visit My Account and select ‘Transfer Ownership’. The other party must have an OnePass account to make the transfer. For all other services visit any Singtel Shop to make the transfer. Both parties must be present with personal identification documents.

column1: What documents are needed for a transfer of ownership for my Singtel services?
column2: Both parties will need to bring their original personal identification documents for a transfer of ownership. If the transferee is a foreigner they will also need:  Employment Pass/Work Permit/Social or Dependent Pass with at least 6 months validity to the date of expiry Purchase Agreement/Tenancy Letter (with proof of occupancy for more than 6 months) Passport

column1: How do I know if I have any Singtel Vouchers?
column2: You can check for any available Singtel Vouchers via:   My Singtel app Under 'Rewards' > 'My Rewards Summary'

column1: How do I sign up for a Singtel plan while retaining my existing mobile number from another local service provider?
column2: When signing up for a postpaid mobile plan at Singtelshop.com or at any Singtel Shop you can opt to retain your existing mobile number when prompted to choose a number. You may experience a service disruption on the day of the port-in however Singtel will try to minimize the inconvenience by only provisioning the port-in during off-peak hours. An SMS notification will be sent to inform you of the date of your port-in.

column1: How do I check my scheduled installation timing?
column2: At Check your Singtel Appointment you can check the details of your installation appointment. Your assigned engineer details will also be available on the day of your appointment.

column1: How can I change my installation appointment?
column2: You can change your Singtel installation appointment at My Account (under ‘My Appointments’). Appointment changes can only be made at least 2 days before your appointment. For change of NetLink Trust appointments please call 1688.

column1: How do I check my outstanding balance for my Singtel account?
column2: You can check your outstanding balance through one of the following:  My Account Login to your account and view the balance amount on the Summary page. My Singtel app Check under Bills tab for outstanding balance and due date.

column1: How do I update my billing/mailing address?
column2: Visit one of the following to update your billing/mailing address:  My Account Select the ‘Change address’ option under your account number. My Singtel app Under ‘Bills’ select ‘Change Address’.

column1: Why are my roaming charges more than expected?
column2: You might have unexpected roaming charges due to the following:  You may have unknowingly accessed content that needs an internet connection through data roaming. If you were on a data roaming plan you might have switched to a non-preferred network automatically. To prevent this in future change your network settings to manual selection in your phone’s settings.

column1: How do I add a mobile line nomination for my bundle plan?
column2: Mobile Line Nomination can be made online at Mobile Line Nomination.  Mobile Line Nomination is only available for:   Fibre Entertainment Bundle Fibre Entertainment Bundle+ Fibre Home Bundle

column1: When can I recontract my plan?
column2: You can check your recontract eligibility via My Account. For postpaid mobile plans you can also check your recontract eligibility via My Singtel app. An early device upgrade fee will apply if you are recontracting less than 21 months into your contract. For all services a downgrade penalty will apply if you changing to a lower tier plan before your contract ends.

column1: How do I transfer ownership for my Singtel services?
column2: For postpaid mobile plans visit My Account and select ‘Transfer Ownership’. The other party must have an OnePass account to make the transfer. For all other services visit any Singtel Shop to make the transfer. Both parties must be present with personal identification documents.

column1: What documents are needed for a transfer of ownership for my Singtel services?
column2: Both parties will need to bring their original personal identification documents for a transfer of ownership. If the transferee is a foreigner they will also need:  Employment Pass/Work Permit/Social or Dependent Pass with at least 6 months validity to the date of expiry Purchase Agreement/Tenancy Letter (with proof of occupancy for more than 6 months) Passport

column1: How do I sign up for a Singtel plan while retaining my existing mobile number from another local service provider?
column2: When signing up for a postpaid mobile plan at Singtelshop.com or at any Singtel Shop you can opt to retain your existing mobile number when prompted to choose a number. You may experience a service disruption on the day of the port-in however Singtel will try to minimize the inconvenience by only provisioning the port-in during off-peak hours. An SMS notification will be sent to inform you of the date of your port-in.

column1: How do I check my outstanding balance for my Singtel account?
column2: You can check your outstanding balance through one of the following:  My Account Login to your account and view the balance amount on the Summary page. My Singtel app Check under Bills tab for outstanding balance and due date.

column1: How can I check my data usage?
column2: You can check your local data usage through one of the following:  My Singtel appFound under the 'Usage' tab. My AccountClick ‘Show details and usage’ for the line you want to check Dial *3282 with your Singtel mobile line. To check on your roaming data usage please check through My Singtel app under ‘Roaming’.

column1: How can I use my Singtel Mobile Postpaid line overseas?
column2: To use your Singtel postpaid mobile line while overseas you must first subscribe to either AutoRoam or activate Pay-As-U-Roam after which you can subscribe to SMSVoiceRoam and DataRoam Plans for value roaming options. Subscribe to these roaming add-ons via: My Account My Singtel app Dial *100# when overseas

column1: Why are my roaming charges more than expected?
column2: You might have unexpected roaming charges due to the following:  You may have unknowingly accessed content that needs an internet connection through data roaming. If you were on a data roaming plan you might have switched to a non-preferred network automatically. To prevent this in future change your network settings to manual selection in your phone’s settings.

column1: Will there be any charges if I receive a call when I am overseas?
column2: Yes there will be charges incurred for receiving and making calls overseas. Visit Roaming Rates to find out about roaming rates in your destination country. Alternatively do check out Singtel's SMSVoiceRoam Plans to enjoy cost savings.

column1: How do I make an overseas call from Singapore on my Singtel postpaid mobile or Singtel home line?
column2: Any of the following Singtel IDD services allows you to make an overseas call from Singapore:  v019 Overseas calls at attractive low rates IDD 001 High call quality at reasonable rates  These calling services are available at your convenience and do not require subscription but need to be activated for your line.

column1: How can I activate my Singtel IDD services?
column2: The steps to activate your Singtel IDD services depends on your service provider:  If you are applying for your Singtel mobile or fixed line call 1688 If you are applying for your StarHub or M1 line call 104

column1: I have lost my mobile phone. What should I do and how can I get a replacement SIM Card?
column2: Call our hotline 1688 (or +65 6235 1688 if calling from overseas) immediately to report the loss. The mobile line will be temporarily disconnected to prevent unauthorised calls. Our Customer Care officers will also advise you on how you can request a replacement SIM Card.

column1: How do I check the balance on my hi!SIM Card (including Data bundle)?
column2: You can check your hi!SIM Card balance via any of the following:  hi!Account(Free Access in Singapore) Calling 9676-7777 (toll free) and press 1 Dial *100#

column1: How can I top-up the value on my Prepaid Card?
column2: Besides using a top-up card to top-up your hi! Card you can also: Top-up online at hi!Account (Free Access) Use My Singtel app Top-up at any Self-service Automated Machine (SAM) DBS/POSB ATM or AXS Station Call 1900 914 1488 from a Singtel Residential Line Dial *1355 via a Singtel Postpaid Line

column1: How can I purchase Data Plan or Social Plan on my Prepaid Card?
column2: You can purchase a Prepaid Data Plan or Social Plan via any of the following: Visit hi!Account (Free Access in Singapore) Call *100# Use My Singtel app Purchase selected data plans from any Authorised Prepaid Retailer

column1: How can I make a top-up to my prepaid card while overseas?
column2: You can perform an online top-up via Credit Card/ eNETS/  UnionPay on hi!Account Alternatively you may purchase a hi! Top-up Card before leaving Singapore. Applicable hi! Top-up Cards are $10 hi! Top-up Card $20 hi!  Top-up Card and $50 hi! Top-up Card. Only these cards can be used when roaming. When overseas dial 132<10 Digit Top-up Card Number><6 Digit Pin Number># on your mobile phone to top up your hi!  SIM Card.

column1: How can I make calls from my prepaid card while I am overseas?
column2: To make calls from your prepaid card while overseas just follow these steps:  Dial *131* followed by the Country Code (e.g. 65 for Singapore) and the telephone number of person you wish to contact Press the # key and make the call You will need a minimum balance of $8 in your main account to make a roaming call. Please note that the availability of Prepaid Roaming depends on the foreign network operator their coverage and the handset used.

column1: How can I use data on my Prepaid Mobile line while I am overseas?
column2: To use Data on your Prepaid card while overseas you can subscribe to hi!DataRoam Plans which are available in the following options:  1GB data with a validity of 30 days in 2 destination packs 100MB data with a validity of 7 days for Malaysia and Australia

column1: How can I activate my hi!DataRoam plan?
column2: To get your hi!DataRoam Plans:  Call *100# or log in to hi!Account (Free Access in Singapore) to purchase your hi!DataRoam Plan While overseas connect to the preferred network operator and call *100# to activate your hi!DataRoam Plan within 30 days of purchase. You will not be charged for this call. The price of the purchased plan will be deducted from your Main Account.

column1: How can I send an SMS from my prepaid card while I am overseas?
column2: To send an SMS from your prepaid card while overseas simply add a + in front of your recipient’s mobile number. Take note that the SMS will not send if the “+” sign is omitted. You will need a minimum balance of $8 in your main account to send a roaming SMS.

column1: How will I be charged when I use my Singtel Prepaid Mobile line overseas?
column2: You can check local call and SMS rates under Rates on the Prepaid Mobile Cards page. If you are overseas you can also dial *100# to check the rate.

column1: How do I make an overseas call from Singapore on my Prepaid card?
column2: To make an overseas call dial 019. You can view the rates at ‘Overseas Call Rates’. For higher call quality you might want to use IDD 001. To do so dial +. You can view the rates at IDD 001.

column1: How do I check my scheduled installation timing?
column2: At Check your Singtel Appointment you can check the details of your installation appointment. Your assigned engineer details will also be available on the day of your appointment.

column1: How can I change my installation appointment?
column2: You can change your Singtel installation appointment at My Account (under ‘My Appointments’). Appointment changes can only be made at least 2 days before your appointment. For change of NetLink Trust appointments please call 1688.

column1: When can I recontract my plan?
column2: You can check your recontract eligibility via My Account. For postpaid mobile plans you can also check your recontract eligibility via My Singtel app. An early device upgrade fee will apply if you are recontracting less than 21 months into your contract. For all services a downgrade penalty will apply if you changing to a lower tier plan before your contract ends.

column1: How do I transfer ownership for my Singtel services?
column2: For postpaid mobile plans visit My Account and select ‘Transfer Ownership’. The other party must have an OnePass account to make the transfer. For all other services visit any Singtel Shop to make the transfer. Both parties must be present with personal identification documents.

column1: I want to change/reset my broadband/WiFi password.
column2: Your default WiFi password can be found on a sticker at the side or bottom of your modem. If you wish to change your WiFi password visit http://192.168.1.254 to view your router configuration page. Check under 'Wireless' and change either your 'WPA Pre Shared Key' or your 'Network Key'.

column1: I'm moving and need to relocate my services. How do I inform Singtel?
column2: You'll want to submit your relocation request 2-3 weeks in advance as appointment slots are subject to availability. Submit your request through:  My Account Our online webform  Calling 1688 (Relocation Hotline Operation Hours: Mon-Sat 8.30am-6pm)

column1: I cannot connect to the internet. What should I do?
column2: You can troubleshoot your internet connectivity issues using our step-by-step guide.

column1: How do I check my scheduled installation timing?
column2: At Check your Singtel Appointment you can check the details of your installation appointment. Your assigned engineer details will also be available on the day of your appointment.

column1: How can I change my installation appointment?
column2: You can change your Singtel installation appointment at My Account (under ‘My Appointments’). Appointment changes can only be made at least 2 days before your appointment. For change of NetLink Trust appointments please call 1688.

column1: How do I purchase Video on Demand on Singtel TV?
column2: Video on Demand (VOD) can easily be accessed via the Singtel TV Remote Control. Visit Video on Demand for available programmes. If you wish to buy a channel that is not part of your existing package you may be required to sign up for a different plan. Call 1609 to speak with our call agent.

column1: How do I retrieve my Singtel TV number?
column2: There are two ways for you to retrieve your Singtel TV number:  On your Singtel bill it would appear in this line ‘Singtel TV NO. xxxxxxxx” On My Singtel app under Singtel TV it would appear in this line ‘No: xxxxxxxx’ If the above options are not available to you you may call 1688 and speak to our call agents.

column1: What are the supported devices for Singtel TV GO?
column2: You can view the latest list of supported iOS and Android devices at Singtel TV GO - List of Compatible Devices.

column1: How do i ensure that my children are not exposed to R21 content?
column2: A R21 Pin is required to access restricted content on your Singtel TV set-top box or on Singtel TV GO. To acquire the pin call 1688 or visit any Singtel Shop.  See:R21 Pin set-up guideFAQs on R21 Pin

column1: My remote control is not working. What should I do?
column2: First check if the battery needs a replacement. If it does not work you should bring along your faulty remote control for a 1 to 1 exchange at any Singtel Shop (excluding Singtel Exclusive Retailers) or +Serv service centers.

column1: How do I change my home line number?
column2: To change the number of your home line you can visit any Singtel Shop or call 1688 to speak with a call agent. Charges will depend on the type of number that is being requested and requests will take 3 working days to process. Only the registered account holder may write in to request a change of number and all accounts' must have no outstanding balance before the change of number is processed.

column1: How do I sign up for a new Telephone Service?
column2: You may walk in to any Singtel Shop to apply for a new telephone line. Singtel customers with existing telephone lines can also call 1688 and speak to our call agents.

column1: I am going overseas for a few months. Can I temporarily suspend my home line?
column2: To suspend your line temporarily please walk in to any of our Customer Service Counters to make your request. Your monthly telephone service and any value-added services subscriptions will continue while your line is temporarily suspended.

column1: How do I transfer ownership for my Singtel services?
column2: For postpaid mobile plans visit My Account and select ‘Transfer Ownership’. The other party must have an OnePass account to make the transfer. For all other services visit any Singtel Shop to make the transfer. Both parties must be present with personal identification documents.

column1: How do I make an overseas call from Singapore on my Singtel postpaid mobile or Singtel home line?
column2: Any of the following Singtel IDD services allows you to make an overseas call from Singapore:  v019 Overseas calls at attractive low rates IDD 001 High call quality at reasonable rates  These calling services are available at your convenience and do not require subscription but need to be activated for your line.

column1: How can I activate my Singtel IDD services?
column2: The steps to activate your Singtel IDD services depends on your service provider:  If you are applying for your Singtel mobile or fixed line call 1688 If you are applying for your StarHub or M1 line call 104

column1: Can I trade-in my mobile device online?
column2: You'll be able to trade-in your mobile device when you purchase on your computer browser.  Choose the brand and model of the device you're trading-in when confirming your shopping cart. Note: Only delivery to your address is available Present your mobile device original battery and any accessories that came with your device to our courier upon delivery.  Do make sure your phone is not damaged or faulty to ensure your trade-in is accepted.

column1: Can I change my order details?
column2: I'm afraid that we cannot make any changes to or cancel your online order once you've submitted it.

column1: What if the device I have received is faulty?
column2: For mobile phones (excluding Apple & Xiaomi) purchased at Singtel.com and: Is not activated; Call 1688 within 7 days of receiving your device Is activated; Bring your phone to the brand's Equipment Service Centre   For hardware issues on your Apple or Xiaomi bring your phone to the respective Equipment Service Centres.

column1: What are the available delivery options for my mobile purchase made at Singtel.com?
column2: Choose from the following delivery options for online purchase:   Delivery to preferred address Self-collection at POPStation or Singtel Retail Shops (Existing Singtel Customers only)  You will not be able to change delivery methods once you have confirmed your order.

column1: What if I’m unable to collect my purchase in person?
column2: If something crops up at the last minute you may appoint a representative to collect on your behalf with the following documents:   Your representative’s original NRIC/Foreigner ID An authorisation letter signed by you Your original NRIC/Foreigner ID   Please note that your representative needs to be at least 21 years old.

column1: When will I receive my One Time Pin (OTP) for POPStation collection?
column2: You will be notified that your purchase is ready for collection between 2pm to 6pm of the indicated collection day via SMS and email. Your locker number and collection One Time PIN (OTP) will be provided in the SMS and email.  Most of the POPStations are available for collection 24 hours a day.  See: Collection hours for every POPStation

column1: What should I do if I can't collect my order before the date stated in the POPStation SMS/Email notification?
column2: You will need to collect your items within 5 days after receiving the notification SMS and email after which your order will be sent to SingPost Warehouse.  Visit POPStation's FAQ for more enquiries regarding POPStation collection and order.

column1: How do I activate my SIM card when I re-contract online?
column2: Follow these steps to activate your SIM Card:  Dial 6220 1011 (available 24 hours) Key in details as prompted Within an hour your new SIM Card will be activated. Please activate your SIM card within 7 days after receiving it.

column1: What is my IMSI number for activating my SIM?
column2: Your IMSI number is a set of 15 digits that can be found at the back of your SIM card.

column1: How do I sign up for a Singtel plan while retaining my existing mobile number from another local service provider?
column2: When signing up for a postpaid mobile plan at Singtelshop.com or at any Singtel Shop you can opt to retain your existing mobile number when prompted to choose a number. You may experience a service disruption on the day of the port-in however Singtel will try to minimize the inconvenience by only provisioning the port-in during off-peak hours. An SMS notification will be sent to inform you of the date of your port-in.

column1: When can I recontract my plan?
column2: You can check your recontract eligibility via My Account. For postpaid mobile plans you can also check your recontract eligibility via My Singtel app. An early device upgrade fee will apply if you are recontracting less than 21 months into your contract. For all services a downgrade penalty will apply if you changing to a lower tier plan before your contract ends.

column1: How do I know if I have any Singtel Vouchers?
column2: You can check for any available Singtel Vouchers via:   My Singtel app Under 'Rewards' > 'My Rewards Summary'

column1: How do I change/reset my OnePass password?
column2: Visit Reset OnePass Password to change or reset your OnePass password.

column1: How do I check my scheduled installation timing?
column2: At Check your Singtel Appointment you can check the details of your installation appointment. Your assigned engineer details will also be available on the day of your appointment.

column1: How can I change my installation appointment?
column2: You can change your Singtel installation appointment at My Account (under ‘My Appointments’). Appointment changes can only be made at least 2 days before your appointment. For change of NetLink Trust appointments please call 1688.

column1: I am an existing Multi-SIM customer and would like to recontract online.
column2: If you're subscribed to Multi-SIM you'll be able to recontract to Singtel Combo plans online. SIM Card charges will apply if you choose to receive a new SIM Card during checkout.  To assign your new SIM Card as your Master SIM dial *141#.

column1: I don’t have a corporate email address or cannot receive external emails. How can I enjoy the online offers?
column2: You may call us at 1609 between 9am to 9pm daily.

column1: I don't see the CIS discount while I'm ordering online.
column2: If applicable the handset discount will be automatically applied at the checkout page after you have logged in to OnePass.

column1: I am unable to submit my order.
column2: Please clear your cache and cookies on your browser before trying to re-login on our CIS online shop.  If that didn't work call us at 1688 and we'll check for you.
